H0.text: Cave is the most likely formation resulting from the deposition of sediment.

H1.text: Delta is formed by deposition of sediment.

H2.text: River is most likely formed by deposition of sediment.

H3.text: A mountain is most likely formed by the deposition of sediment.

A4.text: Deposited sediments are the source of sedimentary rocks.

A5.text: Deposition is the geological process in which sediments, soil and rocks are added to a landform or landmass.

A6.text: Deposition can also refer to the buildup of sediment from organically derived matter or chemical processes.

A7.text: Settling – Process by which particulates move towards the bottom of a liquid and form a sediment

A8.text: Sedimentary rock – Rock formed by the deposition and cementation of particles
